sections.heading: Overview
content: Rosalind Ekman Ladd, PhD is a professor of philosophy at Wheaton College in Norton, Massachusetts. She teaches courses in ethics, medical ethics, philosophy and literature, children's rights, ancient philosophy, philosophical issues in women's health, philosophical issues in mental illness. Ladd's research interests include issues about children's rights, especially in health care; in adolescent decision-making; and in women's issues. She is the author of Children's Rights Re-Visioned , an anthology of philosophical readings; Ethical Dilemmas in Pediatric Medicine (with E.N. Forman), a book of case studies; and articles on adolescent values, domestic violence, and impartiality. Ladd earned a BA from Wheaton College, and an MA and PhD from Brown University.
